newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: QANTAS, BA EXPAND CODE SHARING.
newsitem.headline: QANTAS, BA EXPAND CODE SHARING.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Wednesday it will expand its commercial alliance with British Airways Plc with the introduction of code share flights between Brisbane, Singapore and London.
Qantas, which is 25 percent owned by British Airways (BA), said the changes which come into effect on October 26, include:
- Five nonstop British Airways flights each week between Brisbane and London via Singapore. These flights will carry a Qantas flight designator.
- Three Qantas services each week between Brisbane and Singapore. These flights will carry a BA flight designator.
- Reduced transit times in Singapore for Qantas passengers on flights to London to one hour 10 minutes from four hours.
Qantas also said it will also expand its services to Asia this week with the introduction of two weekly services to China from Thursday and a fifth weekly service to the Philippines from August 17.

In a separate announcement, Qantas said it will relocate its airport operations at London's Heathrow to Terminal Four from Terminal Three to provide passengers with an increased range of services and facilities, including easier European connections.
